name: Fundación Secretariado Gitano
goal:
The Fundación Secretariado Gitano (FSG) is a Spanish non-profit intercultural organisation which provides services for the development of the Roma community in Spain and at the European level. It was legally constituted in 1982.

The mission of the Fundación Secretariado Gitano (www.gitanos.org) is the social inclusion and promotion of the Roma community based on respect and support for their cultural identity. The purpose of this mission is to support the access of Roma people to rights, services and resources on an equal footing with all other citizens. To that end, the FSG implements a broad range of activities which contribute to achieving full citzenship for Roma, improving living standards, promoting equal treatment and preventing all forms of discrimination, while promoting the recognition of the cultural identity of the Roma community.

The FSG is a nation-wide organisation in Spain, with 55 local offices, an average of 700 staff members and 630 volunteers, implementing 491 programmes with 28,433 beneficiaries of our activities (2016).
interests: Communication, Culture, Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, External Relations, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Information Society, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Public Health, Regional Policy, Trans-European Networks, Youth
euInitiatives:
The FSG follows closely a wide range of EU initiatives, policies and legislation concerning social inclusion of vulnerable groups, especially Roma, in order to ensure the effective implementation of the EU initiatives addressed to promote social inclusion and assess the progress made
• EU Framework for National Roma Integration Strategies
• Framework strategy for non-discrimination and equal opportunities for all
• European Platform against Poverty and Social Exclusion
• Cohesion Policy
• Fundamental Rights
Preparation of information and position papers related to Roma inclusion in the framework of European policies and institutions.
Lobby and contacts with MEP
Joint activities and projects with other civil society organisations
